means: 奉承拍马的，卑躬屈膝的

sentence.Network_en: Barrow was positively obsequious to me until he learnt that I too was the son of a labouring man.
sentence.Network_cn: 巴罗竭力讨好我，直到得知我也是工人家庭出身。

sentence.Network_en: He looked at the two ladies with an obsequious air.
sentence.Network_cn: 他看着两位太太,满脸谄媚的神情.

sentence.Network_en: The landladies paid court to her, in the obsequious way landladies have.
sentence.Network_cn: 女店主们以她们特有的谄媚方式向她献殷勤.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... sequacity n 盲从 obsequious a 谄媚的，奉承的 pursue v 追赶；追击.
英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... sequacity n 盲从 obsequious a 谄媚的，奉承的 pursue v 追赶；追击.
以o开头的英语英文单词 ... obsequies 葬礼 obsequious 逢迎的，谄媚的 observance 遵守，奉行（法律，习俗）.
蓝宝词典 ... obscure adj. 暗的,模糊的,无名的 obsequious adj. 谄媚的,奉承的,顺从的 observatory n. 天文台.

list.abs: hear ye , hear ye the drum roll begins , an usher to the rolling waves catapulting towards your obsequious shores .你们听吧，听到那隆隆鼓声开始响起，它预示着滚滚而来的巨浪正投射向你们这卑微的彼岸。
the first care of the young bird as soon as fledged , and able to trust to his wings , is to perform the obsequies of his father .一旦羽翼丰满就接管幼鸟最初照料责任，以及能够信赖它的翅膀，将要完成他父亲的葬礼的任务。
Chandler ' s weasel face screwed into an obsequious smile ., 钱德勒黄鼠狼似的脸上现出了谄媚的笑容.

his obsequious behavior made everyone nervous . he was always rushing and perform other small tasks , apologizing unnecessarily for any inconvenience that he might have caused .他总是逢迎的态度使每个人都不安。他经常冲出门去做些小事，为任何他可能造成的不便而进行不必要的道歉。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (not depreciatory in sense in early use): from Latin obsequiosus, from obsequium 'compliance', from obsequi 'follow, comply with'

entry.def: If you describe someone as obsequious, you are criticizing them because they are too eager to help or agree with someone more important than them.

example.ex: Barrow was positively obsequious to me until he learnt that I too was the son of a labouring man.
example.tran: 巴罗竭力讨好我，直到得知我也是工人家庭出身。

means.word_mean: 1. attempting to win favor from influential people by flattery
2. attentive in an ingratiating or servile manner;

auth_sentence.content: Was he so unmanned, so obsequious, so humbly offering his services reassuring?
auth_sentence.res_content: Was he so unmanned, so obsequious, so humbly offering his services reassuring?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Was he so unmanned, so obsequious, so humbly offering his services reassuring?

auth_sentence.content: An army may be so constituted as to be...efficient against an enemy, and yet obsequious to the...magistrate.
auth_sentence.res_content: An army may be so constituted as to be...efficient against an enemy, and yet obsequious to the...magistrate.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: An army may be so constituted as to be...efficient against an enemy, and yet obsequious to the...magistrate.

auth_sentence.content: For Nat, though, Moby embodies his personal hell, the pit of obsequious whiteness he's spent his whole life sidestepping.
auth_sentence.res_content: For Nat, though, Moby embodies his personal hell, the pit of obsequious whiteness he's spent his whole life sidestepping.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: For Nat, though, Moby embodies his personal hell, the pit of obsequious whiteness he's spent his whole life sidestepping.

stems_affixes.word_buile: ob加强+sequ跟随,追+ious……的→拼命跟随别人
sequ跟随,追+acious多……的→跟随太多的→盲从的
sequence[[n.先后,次序;连续,数列]]拿省鷄dj.接续而来的
sequent=sequence[n.先后,次序;连续,数列]+ial……的→adj.连续的,一连串的
sub在后面+sequ跟随,追+ent表形容词→随在后面的
con全部+sequence连续→全部连续不断的跟随而来→结果,后果;重要性
second=sequ跟随,追→次等的→第二→秒[分为小时第一等级,秒为二]
sequ跟随,追+ence表名词→跟随→连续
sub在后面+sequ跟随,追+ence表名词→随在后面
